column1: Comenius Yorkshire and the Humber host Regional Support Group (ELL RSG) sessions for
the West Yorkshire region at Leeds Trinity &amp
column2: All Saints. On behalf of the DfES and in

column1: accordance with the National Languages Strategy, CILT
is managing a network of ELL RSGs across the country,

column2: the Humber centre is one of these.

column1: <table width="80%" height="592"  border="1" align="center" cellpadding="10" cellspacing="0">
LANGUAGES IN THE PRIMARY SCHOOL

column2: Networking Sessions for teachers to be held at Leeds Trinity &amp

column1: These training, networking and information sessions are for all involved in teaching languages to young learners &nbsp
column2: or those interested in starting to teach languages - nursery, foundation, KS1 &amp
column3: KS2 Class teachers, Learning support assistants, Headteachers and Governors.

column1: Session will include Mime and Movement with David Hicks
column2: Montpellier Presentation by Hothfield Primary School and resource displays by Harcourt Education and LCP.

column1: Session will include Focus on Interactive Whiteboard Materials by Promethean
column2: Good Practice in School Presentation by Rawdon St Peter's Primary School
column3: Resource Presentation by Early Start Resources
column4: and resource display by Harcourt Education.

This training and networking group meets once each term and brings together ELL trainers and co-ordinators from across the West Yorkshire region. We welcome members of NALA and ALL, ITT trainers, LEA Advisers, ATs and ASTs, primary links co-ordinators from SLCs or secondary languages departments, and co-ordinators from primary schools.
Download booking form (word document)
PLEASE ENSURE YOU BOOK YOUR PLACE ON THE ABOVE SESSIONS BY CALLING 0113 283 7226
Catherine Cheater, who has worked at a national level
in policy making for early language learning and is co-author
of two CILT Young Pathfinders, is the Early Language Teaching
For an example of Catherine's training methods, please click here for first video clip and click here for second video clip.
<li> We have at least 5 ELL RSG twilight
sessions each year, at no cost to participating
teachers (<strong>but please let us know if you wish to come
along!). We welcome primary and secondary teachers to
these meetings, as well as ITT trainers, foreign language
assistants, teaching support assistants, ASTs and PGCE
forums each term, to which any of the above are welcome.
• The national ELL website is at www.nacell.org.uk.
NACELL is the National Advisory Centre on Early Language
Learning, based at CILT (Centre for Information on Language
Teaching and Research). See www.cilt.org.uk.
The NACELL website gives details of CILT ELL training
courses in this country and abroad. NACELL can be contacted
<li> Primary schools wishing to develop ELL in the curriculum
will find that the CILT DIRECT PRIMARY scheme offers
a fully comprehensive package of information and support.
Details of this scheme can be found at www.nacell.org.uk/ciltdirect.htm
• Training Courses at home and abroad - www.cilt.org.uk/cpd/primary.htm
